name: cement production, Portland SR3 | cement, Portland SR3 | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/28311/documentation

The information details the manufacturing of CEM SR3 using milled limestone and gypsum as fillers.The dataset describes the production of cement (CEM SR3). Tunisia has five types of cement (CEM I to CEM V) based on the supplementary cementitious materials (limestone).;CEM SR3 is a Sulphate Resistant Cement that is made by 95-90% of clinker and mixed with 5 to 10% of limestone.;Portland SR3 production process consists of four main steps: (1) Quarrying of limestone and other  raw materials to the processing plant. (2) Preparation of “raw meal” for pyroprocessing (3) Pyroprocessing of raw materials to produce clinker using the dry process. (4) Final grinding of the clinker together with inter-grinding with a small proportion of gypsum to produce Portland SR3 cement. Steps (1) to (4) are not considered in dataset.;NT47.01(2017): Ciment - Partie 1: Composition, spécifications et critères des conformité des ciments courants

From the reception of raw materials at the cement factory.

 This activity ends with the Portland cement SR3 produced in the cement silos (after milling). The dataset does not include packaging and administration
category: C:Manufacturing/23:Manufacture of other non-metallic mineral products/239:Manufacture of non-metallic mineral products n.e.c./2394:Manufacture of cement, lime and plaster

processDocumentation.timeDescription: Time period corresponds to data collection period (2019).
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: The dataset represents the production of Sulfate Resistant Cement (CEM SR3) in Tunisia.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: In Tunisia, all cement production is through dry kiln process. The clinker (90-95%) is ground with gypsum (3-5%) and depending on the type of cement and technical standard (NT-47.01 2017 Eqv EN 197-1) with other materials such as limestone (5 to 10%)  to sulfate resistant cement cement.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: Data represent 15% of Tunisian cement production. This sample is extrapolated to reflect total output in the country. The primary values are regarded appropriate for a typical production of Sulfate Resistant Cement in Tunisia.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Data represent 15% of Tunisia's 2019 cement production. Using confidential surveys, one cement manufacturer gave information on the production of cement in 2019. The manufacturer's estimated cement composition is represented by the weighted average of raw material flows. Since manufacturers did not provide the production amounts of each kind of cement owing to privacy issues, the weighting factor utilized is the overall volume of cement produced. The yearly average of the manufacturer unit flows was calculated for additional input flows, such as grinding aids, equipment maintenance supplies, fuels and power. With the exception of the grinding aids, all other flows' consumption is given for the whole cement plant, which often makes several types of cement. Manufacturer information on fuel usage was provided in terms of mass or volume. To make the dataset simpler and to take into account the accompanying air emissions, they were transformed into energy using their lower heating values and modeled as a heat input. The "cement Portland/GLO" information was used to estimate the infrastructure input flow (cement plant) (accessed 15.09.2022). The weighted average of the sample was taken into consideration while calculating the exchange amounts. In order to maintain consistency with other EcoInvent datasets, no conversion to the geometric mean of the lognormal distribution was performed.

exchanges.description:
Sulphate Resistant Cement with 90-95% of clinker and 5-10% limestone.
Estimated from one cement plant, since there no public data on the production of each type of cements in Tunisia (due to confidentiality manner).
